data.title: Corum Group
data.text:
Double-Take Software acquires TimeSpring

Double-Take Software acquired TimeSpring, a continuous data protection software company. The acquisition bolsters Double-Take Softwares protection and back-up capabilities for virtualized and physical server environments. Double-Take Software will integrate TimeSprings unique abilities to create any-point-in-time application consistent recovery points into its suite of product offerings. Double-Take believes TimeSpring offers the best point-in-time recovery capabilities in the market that extend its overall protection and recovery portfolio.

Announcement Date: December 26, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Securitas Systems has acquired Installerende Partners

Securitas Systems has acquired Installerende Partners. Installerende Partners has more than 20 years of experience in the security industry and is a supplier of integrated security and IP satellite services to large customers in Holland. The company has 25 employees. Installerende Partners is an experienced security systems integration firm and has a good reputation for providing superior, custom-fit security systems to its customers. With the acquisition of Installerende Partners, Securitas strengthens its presence in the Netherlands.

Announcement Date: December 21, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed (estimated 5 to 7x EBITDA)

nCipher acquires NeoScale Systems Inc.

nCipher plc, a global leader in protecting critical enterprise data, has acquired NeoScale Systems Inc., a provider of encryption and key management products within the storage security market. NeoScale, a venture-backed private company, based in Milpitas, California, provides a series of appliance-based encryption products under the CryptoStor brand. These are well proven and widely deployed in hundreds of customer locations worldwide; protecting sensitive information stored primarily on back-up tapes and therefore avoiding concerns over data privacy in the event the back-up tapes are stolen or misplaced. This acquisition of the CryptoStor tape product line provides a valuable addition to nCiphers product range, accelerating and strengthening nCiphers position in the rapidly expanding storage encryption market. In addition, NeoScale KeyVault technology and product line will be used to further enhance nCiphers keyAuthority enterprise key management product.

Announcement Date: December 11, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

IBM to acquire Arsenal Digital Solutions

IBM is acquiring Arsenal Digital Solutions. An emerging worldwide leader in on-demand data protection, Arsenal delivers a comprehensive suite of information protection solutions. Arsenal's scalable on-demand services architecture provides customers with automated infrastructure management and gives Arsenal the unique ability to provide solutions to all segments of the marketplace. IBM and Arsenal serve small and mid-market businesses as well as large enterprises that need to achieve data resiliency in light of increasing regulatory requirements, explosive data growth and evolving technology requirements. With the acquisition of Arsenal, IBM will provide global clients with security-rich information protection services designed to handle increasing data retention requirements. Arsenal brings unique capabilities in the online data protection market, complementing IBM Tivoli's flagship data protection offerings and IBM System Storage solutions designed to deliver the industry's most comprehensive portfolio for addressing enterprise information protection needs.

Announcement Date: December 6, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Quest Software to acquire PassGo Technologies

Quest Software, Inc. is acquiring PassGo Technologies Limited (UK), a privately held provider of access and identity management solutions. The addition of PassGos identity management and compliance products to Quests existing user authorization and authentication product set means customers will enjoy a more comprehensive method of managing users and controlling access in multi-platform environments including Microsofts Active Directory, Unix and other platforms including IBM zSeries and iSeries (S/390 and AS/400) systems. Over the past couple years Quest has increased its focused on expanding its Active Directory-based identity management strategy to non-Windows systems, and the addition of PassGo is the next step in its effort to meet customer needs in areas like security and compliance.

Announcement Date: December 5, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Grisoft acquires Exploit Prevention Labs

Grisoft (Czech Republic), developer of the AVG family of security software products, today announced the acquisition of Exploit Prevention Labs, a pioneering developer of safe surfing technology that protects Internet users against malicious websites and drive-by downloaded exploits. Unsafe hyperlinks and the poisoning of legitimate websites represent one of the biggest threats facing computer users since the advent of viruses. LinkScanner technology provides definitive real-time threat protection at the time that matters most  when the user clicks the link. LinkScanner product family will enable Grisoft to provide its 60-plus million users with access to the most complete protection against Internet security threats. The combined operations will give Grisoft the dual advantages of fast reaction and deep research capabilities over other vendors attempting to address this space.

Announcement Date: December 4, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Irdeto acquires Cloakware

Irdeto (The Netherlands), provider of content security for digital TV, IPTV and mobile and a subsidiary of multinational media group Naspers, has acquired Cloakware, a privately held software company. This acquisition strengthens Irdetos existing content security offering, broadens its reach across the entire content lifecycle and vertically expands its offering into new markets. Irdeto has a long history and core competency in content security. Historically, Irdetos security solutions always resided on secure hardware platforms like smart card chips. As the industry matured and consumer content use evolved, the company also developed software-only solutions for IPTV, mobile TV and mobile DRM. Cloakwares technology, which makes security inseparable from the software it protects, adds an additional layer of protection to Irdetos already solid security offering.

Announcement Date: December 4, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Webroot merges with Email Systems

Webroot Software, Inc., a provider of security software for consumer, enterprise and SMB markets, has merged with Email Systems, a SaaS security provider. Email Systems has been providing SaaS-based email and web protection, management and compliance services since 2002. Consequently, Webroot moves decisively into providing security SaaS solutions to enterprise organizations, particularly SMBs. Webroot will now provide a new Email and Web Security SaaS solution that delivers email archiving, image scanning and encryption, anti-spam, anti-phishing and anti-virus services for protecting email, http web filtering and other web-based communications. This strategic combination will leverage the technology expertise, management and client bases of both organizations on a global scale.

Announcement Date: November 27, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

CRYPTEK to acquire ION Networks

Cryptek, Inc., a developer of dynamic and trusted identity and access control solutions, is acquiring substantially all of ION Networks assets, a provider of remote management and secure access products. The ION PRIISMS management portal and proven SSL (Secure Socket Layer) technology enables service providers, equipment manufacturers, federal agencies, and enterprise companies to securely manage, monitor, and protect critical voice and data networks. Over 60,000 ION devices have been deployed worldwide in more than 35 countries. Besides their substantial commercial and international presence, the ION technology is an ideal fit for Crypteks existing federal markets. In addition to the products that exist today, Cryptek sees considerable opportunities for combining both organizations expertise into future innovative security products that will deliver significant value to both Crypteks and IONs customers.

Announcement Date: November 20, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Intersections to acquire Net Enforcers, Inc.

Intersections Inc. is acquiring Net Enforcers, Inc. Net Enforcers is a provider of corporate identity theft protection services, including online brand monitoring, online auction monitoring and enforcement, intellectual property monitoring and other services. Through a combination of proprietary technology and specialized business processes, Net Enforcers helps corporate brand owners prevent illegal trademark and copyright abuse, counterfeit product and service sales, grey market sales, channel policy violations, and other business risks of the online world. Net Enforcers complements Intersections consumer-focused identity theft protection services with a world class offering of corporate identity theft protection services. Combined with its existing data breach response and background screening services, Intersections is building a portfolio of services designed to meet the needs of corporate security officers on a worldwide basis.

Announcement Date: November 12, 2007

Deal Value: $14 million (cash plus potential earnout of $3.5 million)

McAfee buying ScanAlert

McAfee is buying ScanAlert, adding to its Internet security offerings a service intended to help consumers feel safer shopping online. ScanAlert runs daily scans on its more than 75,000 customer websites, hunting and fixing vulnerabilities to qualify for the company's Hacker Safe seal of approval. McAfee said it plans to integrate ScanAlert's technology into its SiteAdvisor service, which alerts web surfers about the safety of the sites they're visiting with a series of red, yellow and green lights. The service warns of sites that infect visitors computers' with malicious code, aggressively display pop-up ads and use submitted e-mail addresses to send spam.

Announcement Date: October 30, 2007

Deal Value: $51 million (cash plus a potential earnout of $24 million)

Trend Micro acquires Provilla

Trend Micro, Inc. is acquiring Provilla, Inc., a leading provider of intelligent endpoint solutions for enterprise data leak protection. Provilla, Inc. provides DLP solutions that combine DataDNA fingerprinting technology with intelligent agents to help enterprise organizations protect their intellectual property and confidential information and maintain regulatory compliance. Trend Micro will continue to offer Provilla's stand-alone products for the near term and will gradually integrate Provillas capabilities into its own enterprise, small and medium business solutions as part of its global content-security solutions.

Announcement Date: October 26, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Wave Group acquires SDG Partners, LLC

Wave Group of Companies, a systems integration and document solutions company, has acquired SDG, LLC, an information security-technology services company. This acquisition accelerates Waves growth strategy and provides new services and solutions for its customers. SDG's focus on data management, information security and disaster recovery/business continuance planning is a perfect complement to Waves vision of access to customer mission critical data anytime, anywhere.

Announcement Date: October 17, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Symantec to buy Vontu

Security software giant Symantec is acquiring Vontu, one of the largest remaining independent providers of data leakage prevention software, which is used to control the flow of sensitive information across corporate networks. The deal gives Symantec a foothold in the burgeoning DLP segment, also referred by some as the ILP (information leakage prevention) space. The two companies already maintain an OEM business partnership, through which Symantec markets Vontu's DLP technologies to its customers. The buyout of Vontu will significantly further the trend of consolidation that has played-out in the red-hot DLP space over the last year.

Announcement Date: October 15, 2007

Deal Value: $300 to $350 million (estimated  cash)

Seller Revenue: $30 million (FY 2007)

McAfee acquires SafeBoot

McAfee acquired mobile encryption provider SafeBoot NV (Netherlands). Netherlands-based SafeBoot, which also offers access control protection, provides device, whole-disk and content encryption. SafeBoot's mobile security solutions address a critical pain point for customers  the protection of confidential and proprietary information. The company caters to customers in more than 75 countries, mostly in Europe, the Middle East and Asia. The purchase complements McAfee's existing data-loss protection solution and its ePolicy Orchestrator, a centralized management and reporting solution.

Announcement Date: October 10, 2007
